basics.name: Pranjal Drall
basics.summary: JD-PhD Candidate in Financial Economics at Yale Law School and Yale School of Management

work.summary: Supported the Carvana trial team by analyzing the standard for class certification in securities fraud cases under Rule 23(b)(3). Drafted a memo outlining the limits of issue preclusion in agency litigation after the McLaughlin decision.

Analyzed the viability of tying/refusal-to-deal claims against a major tech firm under the Sherman and Cartwright Acts. Supported the Incora bankruptcy trial by analyzing the limits of equitable subordination in an uptier transaction.
Drafted memoranda analyzing causation and damages issues in a breach of contract dispute and the limits of an assumption of risk affirmative defense in a climate litigation matter.

work.position: Predoctoral Fellow (Thom Covert and Ryan Kellogg)
work.summary: Developed the first-ever dataset integrating mineral leases, contract terms and production data for the US fracking industry. Quantified the effects of resource misallocation and contractual frictions on firm productivity.

Conducted quantitative research on retirement menu design for a book project. Co-authored a law review article on racial discrimination in child abuse reporting. Assisted with various other law and economics research projects.

education.institution: Yale Law School / Yale School of Management

education.area: B.A. in Mathematics and Economics, with honors

publications.name: Too Liable To Regulate: The Hidden Costs of Fossil Fuel Production
publications.summary: with Terra Baer and Joshua Macey

publications.name: A Markets Based Approach to Public Utility Ratemaking
The Economic Consequences of Farm Foreclosure Moratoria
Rethinking the Politics of Abundance
publications.summary: with Kishore Chundi and Yehonatan Givati
